title: Net Change Theorem
text: We can start by applying net change theorem then use u-substitution to solve for the integral.
speech: We can start by applying net change theorem then use u-substitution to solve for the integral.
pacedSpeech: We can start by applying net change theorem then use u-substitution to solve for the integral.

title: Applying Net Change Theorem
speech: g of 10 minus g of 0 is equal to the integral from 0 to 10 of 2 e to the 0.02 t d t . Note that  g of 0 is equal to 100  is given

title: Solve for g(10)
text: Add both sides by g(0) or $$100$$ to obtain $$g(10)=100+\int_{0}^{10} 2e^{0.02} t \,dt$$
speech: Add both sides by g(0) or  100  to obtain  g of 10, is equal to 100 plus the integral from 0 to 10 of 2 e to the 0.02 t d t

to obtain   g of 10, is equal to 100 plus the integral from 0 to 10 of 2 e to the 0.02 t d t

title: Compute the integral
text: $$100+\frac{2}{0.02} e^{0.02} t$$ with the limit goes from $$t=0$$ to $$t=10$$.
speech: 100 plus, 2 over 0.02, e to the 0.02 t  with the limit goes from  t is equal to 0  to  t, is equal to 10 .

with the limit goes from   t is equal to 0

title: Evaluate the integral
speech: 100 plus 100 e to the 0.2, minus 100 is equal to 122
